members.doc: The AppDefId

members.doc: Item image.

members.doc: Item name.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the notification request was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Request ID.

members.name: autoNotified
members.doc:
Whether a notification was sent automatically.

`autoNotified` is empty when the notification request is created and is not returned until
the field has a value. `autoNotified` receives a value when a notification email is sent for this request object.

`autoNotified` sets to `TRUE` if the notification is sent through the site, either automatically or with [Report Items Back In Stock](/report-items-back-in-stock).
If the notification email is sent offline but the `status` is updated with [Mark As Notification Sent](/mark-as-notification-sent),
then `autoNotified` sets to `FALSE`.

members.name: catalogReference
members.doc:
Catalog and item reference that the notification request is for.

Includes IDs for the catalog and item it came from, as well as additional, optional information.

members.name: contactId
members.doc:
Contact ID for the contact with this `email`.

If a contact does not already exist with the email address submitted when creating this request, then a new contact is created.
For more information about contacts, see the [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/contacts/introduction).

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address to send notification to about item being back in stock.

members.name: itemUrl
members.doc: Item URL for this request.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Status of the notification.

`status` is set to `RECEIVED` when the notification request is created.
The `status` changes once a notification email is sent for this request object:
+ When a notification email is sent through the site, either automatically or with [Report Items Back In Stock](/report-items-back-in-stock), then the `status` is briefly set to `PROCESSING` and then set to `NOTIFICATION_SENT` if the email is successul, and `FAILED` if it fails.
+ When a notification email is sent offline, use [Mark As Notification Sent](/mark-as-notification-sent) to set `status` to `NOTIFICATION_SENT`.

description:
The back in stock notification request allows a customer to receive a notifiction when a specific item
is available again. The request includes information about the person making the request, the item
they want to receive a notification for, and the status of the notification.

members.name: catalogReference
members.doc:
Catalog and item reference.

Includes IDs and additional, optional information related to the item.

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of unique back in stock requests for given `catalogReference`.

description: Maps each back in stock CatalogReference to the results (the number of unique occurrences).

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: id
members.doc: Event ID.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (for example, [GDPR](https://support.wix.com/en/article/gdpr-frequently-asked-questions)). For advanced users.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app providing the catalog. For items from Wix apps, the following values always apply:
+ Wix Stores: `"215238eb-22a5-4c36-9e7b-e7c08025e04e"`
+ Wix Bookings: `"13d21c63-b5ec-5912-8397-c3a5ddb27a97"`

members.name: catalogItemId
members.doc: ID of the item within its Wix or 3rd-party catalog. For example, `productId` for Wix Stores or `bookingId` for Wix Bookings.

members.name: options
members.doc:
Additional info in key:value pairs. For example, to specify Wix Stores product options or variants:
+ `{"options": {"options": {"Size": "M", "Color": "Red"}}}`
+ `{"options": {"variantId": "<VARIANT_ID>"}}`

description: Used for grouping line items and is sent on add to cart

members.name: itemDetails
members.doc: Item details to include in the notification when the item is back in stock.

members.name: request
members.doc:
Notification request information.

Includes details for the out of stock item and the email address
requesting to be notified when it's back in stock.

members.name: request
members.doc: Created back in stock notification request.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc: ID of the notification request to delete.

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: extraAutomationTemplateParameters
members.doc: Additional key-value pairs to pass to the back in stock notification template.

members.name: itemDetails
members.doc:
Item details to use in notifications.

`itemDetails` may populate dynamic valyes in the notification template, as follows:
+ `itemDetails.name` passes to the template as `item.name`
+ `itemDetails.price` passes to the template as `item.price`
+ `itemDetails.image.url` passes to the template as `item.image.url`

Use `extraAutomationTemplateParameters` to pass additional dynamic values.

members.doc:
IDs of requests to send notifications for.

Cannot be used with `catalogReference`.

members.name: cost
members.doc:
Adjust product cost of goods.
If [variant management](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-customizing-product-options#setting-different-prices-for-variants) is enabled,
cost of goods will be adjusted per variant.

members.name: price
members.doc:
Adjust product price.
If [variant management](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-customizing-product-options#setting-different-prices-for-variants) is enabled,
variants prices will be calculated according to the adjusted price.
If variant price is negative after the adjustment, the update will fail.

members.name: weight
members.doc:
Adjust product weight.
If [variant management](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-customizing-product-options#setting-different-prices-for-variants) is enabled,
weight will be adjusted per variant.

variants prices will be calculated according to the adjusted price.
If variant price is negative after the adjustment, the update will fail.

weight will be adjusted per variant.

members.name: choice
members.doc:
Assign this media item to a specific product choice.
Note that you may set media items for choices under only one option (e.g., if Colors blue, green, and red have media items, Sizes S, M, and L can't have media items assigned to them).
You may clear existing media from choices with the [Remove Product Media From Choices](/catalog/products/remove-product-media-from-choices).

members.name: rate
members.doc:
Percentage value, as a whole number (integer) between `-100` and `1000`.

For example:
+ Pass `100` to increase value by 100% (multiply original value by 2).
+ Pass `1000` to increase value by 1000% (multiply original value by 10).
+ Pass `-50` to decrease value by 50% (original value is halved).

members.name: roundToInt
members.doc:
If `true`, result will be rounded to the nearest whole number.
If `false`, result will be rounded to 2 places after the decimal point.

members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Cannot be used together with `paging`. `cursorPaging.cursor` can not be used together with `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Cannot be used together with `cursorPaging`.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Whether the item is available for preorder.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of products that can be preordered after stock reaches zero.

members.name: message
members.doc: A message the buyer will see when the item is out of stock and preorder is enabled.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Product price currency

members.name: discountedPrice
members.doc: Discounted product price (if no discounted price is set, the product price is returned)

members.name: formatted
members.doc: The product price and discounted price, formatted with the currency

members.name: price
members.doc: Product price

members.name: pricePerUnit
members.doc: Price per unit

members.name: baseMeasurementUnit
members.doc: Base measurement unit

members.name: baseQuantity
members.doc: Base quantity

members.name: totalMeasurementUnit
members.doc: Total measurement unit

members.name: totalQuantity
members.doc: Total quantity

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the product was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Product ID (generated automatically by the catalog).

members.name: additionalInfoSections
members.doc: Additional text that the store owner can assign to the product (e.g. shipping details, refund policy, etc.).

members.name: brand
members.doc: Product brand. Including a brand name can help improve site and product [visibility on search engines](https://support.wix.com/en/article/adding-brand-names-to-boost-product-page-seo-in-wix-stores).

members.name: collectionIds
members.doc: A list of all collection IDs that this product is included in (writable via the Catalog > Collection APIs).

members.name: convertedPriceData
members.doc: Price data, converted to the currency specified in request header.

members.name: costAndProfitData
members.doc: Cost and profit data.

members.name: costRange
members.doc: Product cost range. The minimum and maximum costs of all the variants.

members.name: customTextFields
members.doc: Text box for the customer to add a message to their order (e.g., customization request). Currently writable only from the UI.

members.name: description
members.doc: Product description. Accepts [rich text](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-stores/rich-text).

members.name: discount
members.doc: Discount deducted from the product's original price.

members.name: inventoryItemId
members.doc: Inventory item ID - ID referencing the inventory system.

members.name: lastUpdated
members.doc: Date and time the product was last updated.

members.name: manageVariants
members.doc: Whether variants are being managed for this product - enables unique SKU, price and weight per variant. Also affects inventory data.

members.name: media
members.doc: Media items (images, videos etc) associated with this product (writable via [Add Product Media](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-stores/catalog/products/add-product-media) endpoint).

members.name: name
members.doc:
Product name.

Min: 1 character
Max: 80 characters

members.name: numericId
members.doc:
Product’s unique numeric ID (assigned in ascending order).
Primarily used for sorting and filtering when crawling all products.

members.name: price
members.doc: Deprecated (use `priceData` instead).

members.name: priceData
members.doc: Price data.

members.name: pricePerUnitData
members.doc: Price per unit data.

members.name: priceRange
members.doc: Product price range. The minimum and maximum prices of all the variants.

members.name: productOptions
members.doc: Options for this product.

members.name: productPageUrl
members.doc: Product page URL for this product (generated automatically by the server).

members.name: productType
members.doc: Currently, only creating physical products ( `"productType": "physical"` ) is supported via the API.

members.name: ribbon
members.doc: Product ribbon. Used to highlight relevant information about a product. For example, "Sale", "New Arrival", "Sold Out".

members.name: ribbons
members.doc: Deprecated (use `ribbon` instead).

members.name: seoData
members.doc: Custom SEO data for the product.

members.name: sku
members.doc: Stock keeping unit. If [variant management](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-customizing-product-options#setting-different-prices-for-variants) is enabled, SKUs will be set per variant, and this field will be empty.

members.name: slug
members.doc: A friendly URL name (generated automatically by the catalog when a product is created), can be updated.

members.name: stock
members.doc: Product inventory status (in future this will be writable via Inventory API).

members.name: variants
members.doc: Product variants, will be provided if the the request was sent with the includeVariants flag.

members.name: visible
members.doc: Whether the product is visible to site visitors.

members.name: weight
members.doc: Product weight. If [variant management](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-customizing-product-options#setting-different-prices-for-variants) is enabled, weight will be set per variant, and this field will be empty.

members.name: weightRange
members.doc: Product weight range. The minimum and maximum weights of all the variants.

members.name: changedFields
members.doc: List of product fields that were changed.

members.name: productId
members.doc: Product ID.

members.name: brand
members.doc: Product brand.

members.name: costAndProfitData
members.doc: Cost and profit data

members.name: media
members.doc: Media items (images, videos, etc.) associated with this product.

members.doc: Product name.

members.doc: Product price.

members.name: productId
members.doc: Product ID (generated automatically by the catalog).

members.name: sku
members.doc: Product stock keeping unit (SKU). If variants are being managed, this will be empty.

members.name: visible
members.doc: Whether the product is visible to customers.

members.name: productId
members.doc: ID of the product that was deleted.

members.name: choices
members.doc: Choices available for this option.

members.doc: Option name.

members.name: optionType
members.doc: Option type - color or other(drop down)

members.name: _id
members.doc: Requested product ID.

members.name: options
members.doc: Array containing the selected options. For example, `["color": "Blue", "size": "Large"]`.

members.name: availableForPurchase
members.doc: Whether all the selected choices result in a visible, in-stock variant.

members.name: media
members.doc: Information about media items (images, videos, etc.) associated with this choice.

members.name: productOptions
members.doc: Options information (color, size, etc.) for this product, with the inventory and visibility fields updated based on the provided choices.

members.name: selectedVariant
members.doc: Variant information, given that all the choices were provided.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Adjust by amount.

members.name: percentage
members.doc: Adjust by percentage.

members.doc: Adjust by amount.

members.doc: Adjust by percentage.

members.doc: Filter string

members.name: includeDescription
members.doc: Wether to include collection description in the response. When `false` is passed, `collection.description` will return null.

members.name: includeNumberOfProducts
members.doc: Whether number of products should be included in the response.

members.name: query
members.doc: Query options.

members.name: collections
members.doc: List of collections.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: totalResults
members.doc: Total number of results returned.

members.doc: Requested product ID.

members.name: choices
members.doc:
The specific choices available or chosen from within a selection (e.g., choosing the red Selection triggers the red Choice).
You may specify all the relevant choices for a specific variant, or only some of the options, which will return all corresponding variants (not relevant when passing variant IDs).

members.name: includeMerchantSpecificData
members.doc: Whether merchant specific data should be included in the response. Requires permissions to manage products.

members.name: variantIds
members.doc: List of variant IDs (not relevant when passing choices).

members.name: variants
members.doc: List of variants based on the specified filters and sorting.

members.name: includeHiddenProducts
members.doc: Whether hidden products should be included in the response. Requires permissions to manage products.

members.name: includeMerchantSpecificData
members.doc: Whether merchant specific data should be included in the response. Requires permissions to manage products.

members.name: includeVariants
members.doc: Whether variants should be included in the response.

members.name: _id

members.name: names
members.doc: Custom fields to be removed (by name).

members.name: _id
members.doc: Product ID.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Product ID from whose choices to remove media items.

members.name: media
members.doc: Media to remove from choices. If an empty array is passed, all media will be removed from all choices for the given product.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Product ID.

members.name: mediaIds
members.doc: List of media IDs to remove. Pass an empty array to delete all media items for the product.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Product ID.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Collection ID.

members.name: productIds
members.doc: IDs of the products to remove from the collection.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Product ID.

members.name: text
members.doc: Ribbon text

members.name: settings
members.doc: SEO general settings.

members.name: tags
members.doc: SEO tag information.

description:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Product ID.

members.name: customFields
members.doc: Custom field that will be added, if a custom field with the same name already exists, the value of the custom field will be overridden.

members.name: brand
members.doc: Set product brand. Pass empty string to remove existing brand.

members.name: cost
members.doc:
Set product cost of goods.
If [variant management](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-customizing-product-options#setting-different-prices-for-variants) is enabled,
cost of goods will be set per variant.

members.name: price
members.doc:
Set product price.
If [variant management](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-customizing-product-options#setting-different-prices-for-variants) is enabled,
variant prices will be calculated according to the set product price.
If variant price is negative after setting new price, the update will fail.

members.name: ribbon
members.doc: Set product ribbon. Pass empty string to remove existing ribbon.

members.name: weight
members.doc:
Set product weight.
If [variant management](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-customizing-product-options#setting-different-prices-for-variants) is enabled,
weight will be set per variant.

members.name: brand
members.doc: Set product brand. Pass empty string to remove existing brand.

members.name: cost
members.doc:
Set product cost of goods.
If [variant management](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-customizing-product-options#setting-different-prices-for-variants) is enabled,
cost of goods will be set per variant.

members.name: price
members.doc:
Set product price.
If [variant management](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-customizing-product-options#setting-different-prices-for-variants) is enabled,
variant prices will be calculated according to the set product price.
If variant price is negative after setting new price, the update will fail.

members.name: ribbon
members.doc: Set product ribbon. Pass empty string to remove existing ribbon.

members.name: weight
members.doc:
Set product weight.
If [variant management](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-customizing-product-options#setting-different-prices-for-variants) is enabled,
weight will be set per variant.

members.name: keywords
members.doc: User-selected keyword terms for a specific page.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc:
Whether the Auto Redirect feature, which creates `301 redirects` on a slug change, is enabled.

Default: `false` (Auto Redirect is enabled.)

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: inStock
members.doc:
Whether the product is currently in stock (relevant only when tracking manually)
Deprecated (use `inventoryStatus` instead)

members.name: inventoryStatus
members.doc:
The current status of the inventory
+ `IN_STOCK` - In stock
+ `OUT_OF_STOCK` - Not in stock
+ `PARTIALLY_OUT_OF_STOCK` - Some of the variants are not in stock

members.name: quantity
members.doc: Quantity currently left in inventory

members.name: trackInventory
members.doc: Whether inventory is being tracked

members.name: _id
members.doc: Store variant ID. Comprised of the `productId` and the `variantId`, separated by a hyphen: {productId}.{variantId}.

members.name: choices
members.doc: The selected options of this variant. For example, `{"Color": "Blue", "Size": "Large"}`.

members.name: collectionIds
members.doc: Collections that include this variant.

members.name: managedVariant
members.doc: Whether the variant is managed or represents a product.

members.name: media
members.doc: Media items (images, videos) associated with this variant.

members.name: preorderInfo
members.doc: Preorder information.

members.name: productId
members.doc: Product ID.

members.name: productName
members.doc: Product name.

members.name: sku
members.doc: Variant SKU (stock keeping unit).

members.name: stock
members.doc: Variant inventory status.

members.name: variantId
members.doc: Variant ID.

members.name: variantName
members.doc: Variant name.

members.name: children
members.doc: SEO tag inner content. For example, `<title> inner content </title>`.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the tag is a custom tag.

members.name: disabled
members.doc: Whether the tag is disabled.

members.name: meta
members.doc: SEO tag meta data. For example, `{height: 300, width: 240}`.

members.name: props
members.doc:
A `{'key':'value'}` pair object where each SEO tag property (`'name'`, `'content'`, `'rel'`, `'href'`) contains a value.
For example: `{'name': 'description', 'content': 'the description itself'}`.

members.name: type
members.doc:
SEO tag type.

Supported values: `title`, `meta`, `script`, `link`.

members.name: cursor
members.doc: Cursor returned in last query response. Should not be provided on first page request

members.name: limit
members.doc:
The number of items to load.
Cursor token returned in the query response. To be used on the next query request, but not the first query request.

description:
Don't use it unless you have to and know what you do. Prefer PlatformCursorPaging or wix.common.CursorPaging other than this.
It doesn't have max validation for limit but we still MUST have it so implement required validation in your code.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

description:
Don't use it unless you have to and know what you do. Prefer PlatformPaging or wix.common.Paging other than this.
It doesn't have max validation for limit but we still MUST have it so implement required validation in your code.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Cannot be used together with `paging`. `cursorPaging.cursor` can not be used together with `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
members.doc: Filter object.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Cannot be used together with `cursorPaging`.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sorting options. For example, `[{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]`.

description:
Don't use it unless you have to and know what you do. Prefer PlatformQuery other than this.
It doesn't have max validation for limit but we still MUST have it so implement required validation in your code.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Cannot be used together with `paging`. `cursorPaging.cursor` can not be used together with `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Cannot be used together with `cursorPaging`.

members.name: ids
members.doc: ids of subscription options which will be applied to original price

members.name: prices
members.doc:
Original prices to which subscription options discount will be applied.
Key is identifier unique per price that can be used to match calculated prices with original price

members.doc:
Original prices to which subscription options discount will be applied.
Key is identifier unique per price that can be used to match calculated prices with original price

members.doc: ids of subscription options which will be applied to original price.

members.name: items
members.doc: Original prices to be calculated for each corresponding product id with related subscription plan ids

members.name: calculatedPrices
members.doc:
Key is identifier unique per price that can be used to match calculated prices with original price
Value is response with calculated prices for each subscription option

members.name: _id
members.doc: Calculation id (product id)

members.name: calculatedPrices
members.doc:
Key is identifier unique per price that can be used to match calculated prices with original price
Value is response with calculated prices for each subscription option

members.name: calculatedPricesPerProduct
members.doc:
Key is identifier unique per price that can be used to match calculated prices with original price
Value is response with calculated prices for each subscription option for each product
